## Read data
```{r p9}
TSNEdata=read.table('TSNE.csv',row.names=1,header=TRUE, sep=",", stringsAsFactors = FALSE,  dec=".", fill=TRUE)
UMAPdata=read.table('umap.csv',row.names=1,header=TRUE, sep=",", stringsAsFactors = FALSE,  dec=".", fill=TRUE)
```

##Compare GANs versus respective RAWs
```{r GANvRAW}
#you must use either UMAPdata or TSNEdata:
#Assign the actual variable UMAPdata to the variable name MANdata for example
assign("MANdata", UMAPdata)

minit=1000
maxit=500000
method="mlp"
iterations=50
n=NULL

dophenotype <- function (data, classes, label){
   ## Permute and plot. Using "method"
  pe <- permute(
      mat = data, 
      n=n,
      iter = iterations, 
      classes = classes, 
      projmethod = method,
      verbose=FALSE)

  its=0
  solved=FALSE
  while(solved==FALSE){
      its=its+1
      pe1 <- permute(
          mat = data, 
          n=n,
          iter = iterations, 
          classes = classes, 
          projmethod = method,
          seed=i*iterations,
          verbose=FALSE)
      #assimilate all loops
      pe<-c(pe,pe1)
      text<-paste(label,":",its*iterations)
      print(text)
      print(ClusterSignificance::pvalue(pe))
      print(conf.int(pe, conf.level = 0.95))
      real=pe@scores.real$`GAN vs RAW`
      perhits=pe@scores.vec$`GAN vs RAW`
      beats<-perhits-real
      perhits <- length(beats[beats<0])
      text<-paste(perhits," Hits so far")
      print(text)
      flush.console()
      if ((perhits>0) & (its*iterations>minit))
          {solved=TRUE}
    }
  return(pe)
  } 

for (pheno in seq(1,5)){
  i <- ((pheno-1)*4)+1
  j <- ((pheno-1)*4)+2
  k <- ((pheno-1)*4)+3
  l <- ((pheno-1)*4)+4

  label <- paste(method," using  ",  i,":",j," and ", k,":",l, ". Now real iteration:" ,sep="")
  print(label)
  
  #get data and loose any NA
  CON=MANdata[,i:j]
  CON= CON[complete.cases(CON), ]
  names(CON)=c("X","Y")
  TEST=MANdata[,k:l]
  TEST= TEST[complete.cases(TEST), ]
  names(TEST)=c("X","Y")
  # For fair test don't tell Kmeans algo we have two pops ;-)
  data<-rbind(CON,TEST)
  data<-as.matrix(data)
  class1<-rep("GAN", nrow(TEST))
  class2<-rep("RAW",nrow(CON))
  classes=cbind(t(class1),t(class2))[1,]  
  pe<-dophenotype(data,classes,label)
  title<-paste("pheno=",pheno)
  plot(pe,sub=title)
  ClusterSignificance::pvalue(pe)
  conf.int(pe, conf.level = 0.95)
  line <- paste0(label,ClusterSignificance::pvalue(pe))
  write(line,file="autoGANvRAWoutput.txt",append=TRUE)
  write(conf.int(pe, conf.level = 0.95),file="autoGANvRAWoutput.txt",append=TRUE)
}
  

```

##Are the GANs different to each other?
```{r GANvsGAN, echo=FALSE}
#you must use either UMAPdata or TSNEdata:
#Assign the actual variable UMAPdata to the variable name MANdata for example
assign("MANdata", UMAPdata)

minit=1000
maxit=500000
method="mlp"
iterations=50
n=NULL

dophenotype <- function (data, classes, label){
   ## Permute and plot. Using "method"
  pe <- permute(
      mat = data, 
      n=n,
      iter = iterations, 
      classes = classes, 
      projmethod = method,
      verbose=FALSE)

  its=0
  solved=FALSE
  while(solved==FALSE){
      its=its+1
      pe1 <- permute(
          mat = data, 
          n=n,
          iter = iterations, 
          classes = classes, 
          projmethod = method,
          seed=i*iterations,
          verbose=FALSE)
      #assimilate all loops
      pe<-c(pe,pe1)
      text<-paste(label,":",its*iterations)
      print(text)
      print(ClusterSignificance::pvalue(pe))
      print(conf.int(pe, conf.level = 0.95))
      labs<-unique(classes)
      var<-paste(labs[1],"vs",labs[2])
      real=pe@scores.real$'GAN_1 vs GAN_2'
      perhits=pe@scores.vec$'GAN_1 vs GAN_2'
      if (is.null(perhits)){perhits=0}
      beats<-perhits-real
      perhits <- length(beats[beats<0])
      text<-paste(perhits," Hits so far")
      print(text)
      flush.console()
      if ((perhits>0) & (its*iterations>minit))
          {solved=TRUE}
    }
  return(pe)
  } 

comparisons<-list(list(1,2),list(1,3),list(1,4),list(1,5),list(2,3), 
                  list(2,4), list(2,5), list(3,4), list(3,5), list(4,5))
for (comp in comparisons){
  text<-paste(comp[1],":",comp[2])
  print(text)
}

for (comp in comparisons){
  i <- ((as.numeric(comp[1])-1)*4)+1
  j <- ((as.numeric(comp[1])-1)*4)+2
  k <- ((as.numeric(comp[2])-1)*4)+1
  l <- ((as.numeric(comp[2])-1)*4)+2
  label <- paste("method ",method," using  ",  i,":",j," and ", k,":",l, ". Now real iteration:" ,sep="")
  print(label)
  
  #get data and loose any NA
  CON=MANdata[,i:j]
  CON= CON[complete.cases(CON), ]
  names(CON)=c("X","Y")
  TEST=MANdata[,k:l]
  TEST= TEST[complete.cases(TEST), ]
  names(TEST)=c("X","Y")
  # For fair test don't tell Kmeans algo we have two pops ;-)
  data<-rbind(CON,TEST)
  data<-as.matrix(data)
  class1<-rep('GAN_1', nrow(TEST))
  class2<-rep('GAN_2',nrow(CON))
  classes=cbind(t(class1),t(class2))[1,]  
  pe<-dophenotype(data,classes,label)
  plot(pe)
  ClusterSignificance::pvalue(pe)
  conf.int(pe, conf.level = 0.95)
  line <- paste0(label,ClusterSignificance::pvalue(pe))
  write(line,file="AutoGANvGANoutput.txt",append=TRUE)
  write(conf.int(pe, conf.level = 0.95),file="AutoGANvGANoutput.txt",append=TRUE)
}
  

```
